conclusion: Both particles are accelerated to the same velocity v by M, but the second particle, being heavier, might not follow the straight path in N and deviates by d.
If the particle has a different velocity, it will experience a net force and deviate.
Both particles are accelerated by M to velocity v, so why does the second particle deviate?
If both particles are accelerated by the same potential difference, their final kinetic energies should be the same.
The energy gained by a particle in such an accelerator is qV, which equals its kinetic energy.
